snippet: The government’s plans to replace a colonial-era law used to quiet dissent were greeted with cautious optimism by observers as details of the new speech legislation have yet to be released.
abstract: Malaysia’s government announces plans to repeal a colonial-era law used in the past to quiet political dissent, but provides few details; move is greeted by political observers with cautious optimism.
lead_paragraph: The government’s plans to replace a colonial-era law used to quiet dissent were greeted with cautious optimism by observers as details of the new speech legislation have yet to be released.

headline.seo: Malaysia Vows to Repeal Speech Law
headline.main: Malaysia Vows to Repeal Speech Law

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
